=A0AM mode wi=
th the 12-820. This still has the clock/frequency display, I took that off =
later. You figure it costs more, but you also don't need the two relays, a =
chip, and extra board real estate. An external antenna wire can be added as=
 well. I wanted to remove the clock board completely, but there is one wire=
, the "R-On" wire, that when removed kills the radio, and I couldn't=A0sub =
a voltage for it. 
=A0
=A0Frank-S

<html><head><style type="text/css"><!-- DIV {margin:0px;} --></style></head><body><div style="font-family:times new roman, new york, times, serif;font-size:14pt"><P>Very Clear Frank!!</P>
<P>LK</P>
<DIV style="FONT-SIZE: 14pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman, new york, times, serif"><BR><BR>
<DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; FONT-SIZE: 12pt; MARGIN: 5px 0px 5px 5px; BORDER-LEFT: #1010ff 2px solid; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman, new york, times, serif">----- Original Message ----<BR>From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...><BR>To: Group <evp-itc@yahoogroups.com><BR>Sent: Thursday, June 12, 2008 8:38:55 AM<BR>Subject: [EVP-ITC] Power-mod-AM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<P> AM mode with the 12-820. This still has the clock/frequency display, I took that off later. You figure it costs more, but you also don't need the two relays, a chip, and extra board real estate. An external antenna wire can be added as well. I wanted to remove the clock board completely, but there is one wire, the "R-On" wire, that when removed kills the radio, and I couldn't sub a voltage for it. <BR> <BR> Frank-S<BR><BR>

<P></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></div><br>
